title: How easy is it to make a WordPress site? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on what context you are using it in and what purposes you are using it for. And if WordPress seems “simple” to you, I can assure you without any doubt at all that WordPress is overwhelming to most busy business owners who have quotas to meet, employees to catch up with, and staffing or inventory issues to resolve. WordPress is the Earth’s most popular Content Management System. It’s regularly confused with different types of hosting, WordPress’s free hosting platform, WordPress’s open source Content Management System, the company, their WordCamp conventions, their meetup groups, their video channel, and the WordPress “ecosystem” and community. Most businesses want to use WordPress as their website CMS because most people who have some level of technical capability with Office or whatever else programs or platforms, can learn how to update or manage a typical site within a few hours. As someone who has taught many WordPress training bootcamps and had several WordPress meetups with the great folks at WordPress, most people do not have “typical” WordPress websites regardless of what they might be told or feel. Most people have frameworks or hybrid frameworks/premium themes filled with lots of different plugins; and training someone to update that type of customization is an effort all into itself. And that still make one a WordPress developer (as in building professional-level sites). So…maybe it is “that easy” for you if all you have is a WordPress-built theme with minimal plugins, minimal customization and coding, and your goal is to simply update it when needed and keep it going. I have many sites that have zero plugins, load almost immediately, and require updating maybe a few times per year. Some of those are “easy,” but it’s a very relative term and depends on what you’re doing, your goals (if you have some), and what you’re trying to reach. WP is “easy” to manage and update as long as it’s not tricked out to the max.

response.answer_text: How to Make a WordPress Website in 5 Steps Creating a WordPress website is easy and does not require coding or development expertise. To create your WordPress site, you need to get hosting, choose your theme, and design your site. When you’ve created and designed all of your pages, posts, widgets, and site elements, then you can add additional functionality via plug-ins. Here is how to make a WordPress website in five steps. 1. Sign Up for Hosting A host is a service that “stores” your website’s files, and typically also allows you to register your domain name (Home) and business email accounts. While you can use most major hosts to set up a WordPress website, a few have the WordPress CMS pre-installed. 2. Choose Your Domain Name Next, you’ll choose your website domain — like YourBusiness. Most businesses prefer to use a .com name since it’s the most popular and best-known extension. If your top choice is taken, consider adding an extra word, like your city name. Lastly, you’ll enter your payment information and finalize your order. Keep in mind that to get the best pricing, you do need to pay for three years upfront. However, you can also cancel within 30 days for a full refund. If you aren’t happy with how your website turns out, cancel and try a different option. 3. Access WordPress Through Your Bluehost Account Once you’re registered with Bluehost, you’ll be prompted to set a password and confirm your email address. After this, you’ll reach the Bluehost welcome page. Before you begin working on your site, there are three quick steps to complete: Manage your WordPress website. To start, click “My Sites” on the left panel, then “Manage Site.” Find the “Settings” panel. In the box that says “Site URL,” change the temporary URL to the one you purchased. This ensures your new domain is linked up with your new site. Now click the “Security” tab. In the box that says “Free SSL Certificate,” click “Enable.” This will change your website to an “https,” or a secure website that encrypts the transfer of data, which is better for search engine rankings and protects user information. Once those steps are complete, click “Log in to WordPress” to start working on your site. 4. Choose Your WordPress Theme After installing WordPress, you need to choose a theme. A theme is a predesigned website template that you personalize with your own text and photos. It’s much easier than starting from scratch since you get to follow a visual template that is editable with the next text and photos. To create these, we analyzed how visitors are using business websites in 2019. Customers often browse from their smartphones and are looking for quick information at a glance, like operating hours, phone numbers, or street addresses. As a result, we designed our themes to look great on both mobile and desktop and provide this essential information up front. To design your website, you need to input your text and photos. There’s no programming required, although you can modify just about everything like fonts, colors, and formatting from the simple customization menu. 5. Customize Your WordPress Theme & Design Your Site When you first log into WordPress, you will reach your WordPress dashboard. This is the main “control center” of your website where you’ll design your pages, make edits, add blog posts, and other elements using the menu options on the left side: Here’s a quick rundown of each of these menus: Posts: If you want to add a blog to your business website, “Posts” is where you’ll go to write, edit, and publish new blog post articlesPages: This is where you create website pages like your About, Contact, or Pricing pagesAppearance: This is the main menu for editing your website’s style’ under “Appearance,” you can choose between different themes and then customize the colors, fonts, and other formatting options for your websitePlug-ins: These are additional features you can add to your websites like contact forms or e-commerce carts; some plug-ins are free while others charge a one-time or recurring feeThe steps for setting up your website will vary depending on your theme, so it is recommended that you choose a theme first, then finding specific instructions for that theme. If you want to know more about this than I suggest you check out these link Create a WordPress site in 24 hours. I hope it will help you to know more important information about WordPress.
